channel.title: American Shadows
channel.description: American Shadows is a bi-weekly podcast from iHeartRadio and Aaron Mahnke’s Grim & Mild. The show focuses on the darker stories from American history: the people, places, and things that are hidden and forgotten in the shadows. From better-known tales like the conspiracy to steal Lincoln’s body, to less-known stories, like the rainmaker who flooded San Diego. Join host Lauren Vogelbaum as she spans two centuries of omitted lore from our country’s history books.
channel.itunes:summary: American Shadows is a bi-weekly podcast from iHeartRadio and Aaron Mahnke’s Grim & Mild. The show focuses on the darker stories from American history: the people, places, and things that are hidden and forgotten in the shadows. From better-known tales like the conspiracy to steal Lincoln’s body, to less-known stories, like the rainmaker who flooded San Diego. Join host Lauren Vogelbaum as she spans two centuries of omitted lore from our country’s history books.
channel.itunes:author: iHeartPodcasts and Grim & Mild

item.title: Roses of War
item.itunes:title: Roses of War
item.description:
When men went off to fight in WW II, women did their own part. They worked in factories, played in a women's baseball league, and raised families. One woman's family was bigger than the rest. Meet Margaret Chung, who called thousands of military men her sons.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
When men went off to fight in WW II, women did their own part. They worked in factories, played in a women's baseball league, and raised families. One woman's family was bigger than the rest. Meet Margaret Chung, who called thousands of military men her sons.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: iHeartPodcasts and Grim & Mild

item.title: The Write Stuff
item.itunes:title: The Write Stuff
item.description:
The mysogenistic article, 'What Are Girls Good For' infuriated Elizabeth Cochrane. Her well-written response to the newspaper did more than get her point across. It started her career as Nellie Bly, award-winning investigative reporter. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Stolen Lives
item.itunes:title: Stolen Lives
item.description:
Georgia Tann believed the rich were better than those without means. She also believed lower-income couples should not have children This is the story of how thousands of children were stolen and sold in the black market. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Night Life
item.itunes:title: Night Life
item.description:
During times of war and difficulties, people turned to sports and clubs as a way to enjoy friends, a good time, and to forget about their troubles and the headlines for a while. And sometimes, those same nightclubs made the headlines. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Shadow Land
item.itunes:title: Shadow Land
item.description:
For many tourists, Coney Island was the epitome of summer. However, the carnivals and fun houses revealed another side of human nature.

item.title: The Night Season
item.itunes:title: The Night Season
item.description:
Before electricity, those who walked the night were looked down on — and feared. Murderers, thieves, and sex walkers were frightening enough. But those who roamed the night involuntarily—they were feared above all. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Lovesick
item.itunes:title: Lovesick
item.description:
Our quests for love can be disappointing. Maddening, even. When the love story that plays out is different than the one imagined – or the one you had wished for – the results can be devastating... or even deadly. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Grim & Mild Presents: Season 2 Trailer
item.itunes:title: Grim & Mild Presents: Season 2 Trailer
item.description:
This summer, Grim & Mild Presents continues its journey into the strange, the unusual, and the fascinating. For our newest season, we’ll be taking to the high seas to explore one of history’s most notorious types of criminal: pirates.

From naval battles and buried treasure, to deadly sword fights and stolen rum. Prepare to raise anchor! Grim & Mild Presents: Pirates sets sail on Friday, July 8th.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
This summer, Grim & Mild Presents continues its journey into the strange, the unusual, and the fascinating. For our newest season, we’ll be taking to the high seas to explore one of history’s most notorious types of criminal: pirates.

From naval battles and buried treasure, to deadly sword fights and stolen rum. Prepare to raise anchor! Grim & Mild Presents: Pirates sets sail on Friday, July 8th.

item.title: A Spoonful of Sugar
item.itunes:title: A Spoonful of Sugar
item.description:
If something seems too good to be true it often is, from snake oil to opiates the American medical system has tried some radical treatments to heal the sick and make a quick buck. But who stands between us and disaster, quietly uncovering the darkest aspects of so called medical miracles?

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Of Medicine and Miracles
item.itunes:title: Of Medicine and Miracles
item.description:
If I were to tell you that some of the things you know about health and wellness come from behind the veil, would you believe me? There was one man -- a reluctant sleeping prophet -- whose lasting imprint is still felt today. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

item.title: Expendable
item.itunes:title: Expendable
item.description:
On March 25, 1911, a fire broke out in the garment district. Within 18 minutes, 146 people were dead. Though the factory owners were acquitted of wrong doing, the fire paved the way for safety regulations. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Mysterious
item.itunes:title: Mysterious
item.description:
In 1587, 115 people arrived on Roanoke. The newly appointed governor left for England, promising to return with supplies. When he returned, all that remained of the colony was a single word carved in a wooden gate post: Croatoan. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Covert
item.itunes:title: Covert
item.description:
In the 1950s, the CIA was on a quest to create a method of mind control using LSD. Over the next 20 years, the experiment added torture, emotional and sexual abuse, and murder to the experiment. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Firestorm

item.description:

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

But there way one man at the turn of the century who convinced people otherwise -- with disastrous results.

item.title: Official Trailer - American Shadows
item.itunes:title: Official Trailer - American Shadows
item.description:
American Shadows is a bi-weekly podcast from iHeartRadio and Aaron Mahnke’s Grim & Mild. The show focuses on the darker stories from American history: the people, places, and things that are hidden and forgotten in the shadows. From better-known tales like the conspiracy to steal Lincoln’s body, to less-known stories, like the rainmaker who flooded San Diego. Join host Lauren Vogelbaum as she spans two centuries of omitted lore from our country’s history books.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
American Shadows is a bi-weekly podcast from iHeartRadio and Aaron Mahnke’s Grim & Mild. The show focuses on the darker stories from American history: the people, places, and things that are hidden and forgotten in the shadows. From better-known tales like the conspiracy to steal Lincoln’s body, to less-known stories, like the rainmaker who flooded San Diego. Join host Lauren Vogelbaum as she spans two centuries of omitted lore from our country’s history books.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
